item.title: Drupal Camp Toronto 2010: October 15-16
item.description:
If you are seeing this, you are still visiting the Drupalcamp 2008 site.

The next Drupal Camp Toronto is being planned for the weekend of October 15-16, 2010.
item.dc:creator: andremolnar

item.title: Winner of the Active State Prize Pack
item.description:
For those of you who missed the official draw: Jeff from Active State reached into the 'hat' of attendees and pulled out the winning name.

Congratulations to Paul Newby - you are the winner of the Komodo IDE license and Active State t-shirt.
item.dc:creator: andremolnar

item.title: FIS is Looking for Drupal Developers
item.description:
The Faculty of Information Studies at UofT is looking for developers.

Yes, the fine folks who have provided us with the space for this year's event are looking for Drupal talent to help with a project.

FIS is dedicated to supporting the local open source community. So if you are interesting with working with a group that shares your passion, come talk to us in the 'lunch' room during day two and we'll get you in touch.

andre
item.dc:creator: andremolnar

item.title: Schedule and Program
item.description:
The sessions part of the program is to be finalised on Wednesday night, but below is the overall schedule plan. Note that session durations are all an hour and 10 minutes of time, there are 4 slots on each day. Each slot will have up to 3 concurrent sessions.

Friday:

9 am - registration opens, coffee, etc.

10 am - welcome

10:15 am - 11:30 - sessions A

11:30 - 12:45 - sessions B

12:45 am - 2 - lunch

2 pm - 3:15 - sessions C

3:15 - 3:30 - coffee

3:30 pm - 4:45 - sessions D

6:30 pm - Sponsor recognition party at a secret location.

Saturday:

read more
item.dc:creator: adixon

item.title: Attend Drupal Camp Toronto for a chance to win an Active State Prize Package
item.description:
If you didn't already have enough reasons to attend Drupal Camp Toronto we can give you one more.

Active State, makers of the Komodo IDE and other development tools have been kind enough to donate a prize package containing a Komodo IDE license voucher and t-shirt.

We will be announcing a winner of the prize chosen from attendees during Drupal Camp.

Register to attend now as spaces are filling up. We'll see you on May 23rd and 24th.
item.dc:creator: andremolnar

item.title: Like jQuery? Come meet John Resig!
item.description:
I'm pretty excited to announce that the "j" in "jQuery" will be joining us for Drupal Camp this year! In case you were not already aware, Drupal (since version 5.0) comes with the lean, mean and uber-popular Javascript library, jQuery. The author of that library, John Resig will be in town that week and has offered to join us.

Got Javascript questions? Want to learn more about jQuery? Register now and hear it from the man himself!
item.dc:creator: walkah

item.title: Registration is now open!
item.description:
We're live for 2008! The third annual Drupal Camp Toronto is happening May 23rd and 24th, 2008 at the University of Toronto!

Make sure you register early - we have limited space (room for 150) and the spots go quickly! To register - create an account then complete the registration form.

Want to present at DrupalCamp? Propose a session! We'd love to hear from you.

read more
item.dc:creator: walkah

item.title: Welcome to DrupalCampToronto 2008!
item.description:
It's that time of year again! May is coming, which means we're doing another DrupalCampToronto!

When

Friday, May 23rd and Saturday May 24th, 2008. 9am to 5pm.

Where

We'll be at the University of Toronto in the Bissell Building.

140 St. George St
Toronto, ON

map

Register!

Register now! We have space for around 150 people, so make sure you get in before then. And please don't take spots if you're not going to show up. Thanks :)

Present!

Once you've registered please propose a session - the deadline is May 19th

Also check out the other proposed sessions, read through them and vote on your favourites!

Sponsor!

If you're part of Drupal-related business or organization, Drupal Camp is a great opportunity to advertise your services, build networks, and learn more -- and you'll want to sponsor this event. Contact us when you're ready - but make it now if you want your logo on the t-shirt!

read more
item.dc:creator: walkah
